comment: Dr. Morgan is really passionate about marketing and cares. She responds to emails quickly as well.  Attendance was not mandatory but she offers tons of easy participation extra credit opportunities for students who come to class. There was a group project and presentation that was due towards the end. Overall I recommend taking her.

As an online class, this course felt a bit like information overload. The quizzes are kind of hard, but if you do the optional SmartBook quizzes beforehand, then you will be prepared but they're long. She is a strict grader. 1-2 quizzes due per week + a short, easy SmartBook assignment. The group project wasn't bad. The exams were tough.

Dr. Morgan is a great professor. Show up to class, do the work, and make sure to get a good team for the Department-Mandated group project, and you'll do fine in the class. Her lectures are fun and she really likes to get to know her students and their interests outside of class. Very easy A and I learned a lot from her. Would take again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Morgan is a great professor! Definitely show up to class and really study for the tests! Big group project throughout the semester - if you have a good group and don't procrastinate you'll be okay!
Completely ruined my grade at the end because she gave us study guides for the final that ended up having like only half of the information.

During my 4 years here at KSU, I never really interacted with a professor before, but Dr. Morgan is the best professor in the Marketing Department. I had such an amazing time in her class. I'll definitely retake her class. She really cares about her students and will do her absolute best to help you get started on your marketing career.

I usually get A's and B's, but I got a 79.6 in this class, and she DID NOT round it up. I asked for help, and she just said to get a flashcard app and read the book. There are 1-2 LockDown Browser quizzes with a webcam each week and three finals. I copied her PowerPoints, lectures, took notes, and still struggled. Good luck!

Dr Morgan is such a charismatic professor. She is entertaining, genuine, and kindhearted and is willing to help. Plenty of extra credit opportunities, no reason not to get an A in this class as long as you put in the work.

I took Miss Morgan maybe two years ago, and extremely miss her class. She has so many extra credit opportunity, cares for her students, and gives great feedback. Exams are a bit tough, but if you take notes and ask questions, she will help you. If I was in the marketing field, I would take her all the chances I could. DO NOT skip her!!

Prof. Morgan was excellent; she was funny and gave very informative lectures. There is a group project but that is required by the board, if you have to take a MKGT course take hers. Her exams are closed notes and use proctoro; attend class and take good notes, and you'll be fine. She gives out a lot of extra credit opportunities.
BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER TAKEN!!! I just signed up for her class for the 3rd time. A good bit of projects but she grades easily.

The course is very enjoyable. There is a semester-long group project. If you take the group project and essays seriously you will get an easy A. The professor is very knowledgeable in the retail industry and shared her experiences.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Basically test are in person and attendance on zoom sessions are mandatory. Syllabus was wrong regarding attendance. It's not that bad if you are actively involved. Goodluck!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Morgan is a great professor! I recommend the in person class because her lectures are great. The tests reflect the lecture PowerPoints that she uses. She assigns a big group project at the end just make sure you pick good team members and you'll do fine. She has a few mandatory attendance days so watch out for that too.

Took her in person and she is a solid choice. I mean its not that hard just come to class and take notes. She gives extra credit randomly for attending when attendance is low. Lockdown exams, minimal HW, and a group project/presentation that is kinda lengthy. Some people are pressed and overreacting just bc they can't sleepwalk through this class

Decent class. Nothing was hard, just had a lot to do at times. We did a discussion post, quiz, and chapter assignment weekly. On top of that, we had a semester-long group project to work on. Not hard, just time-consuming because we had a lot of milestones to get through for the group project.  She didn't grade hard on anything except group stuff.

Don't know why people did not like her. Prof. Morgan is a great professor for marketing. She's passionate about the subject which made the class less boring. She is somewhat of a tough grader but gives good feedback of why she gives what she gives. Would take again.

This class wasn't hard, just busy work. Make sure you complete all the assignments. There was a weekly discussion post, connect homework and quiz. Plus, you have a group project you work on throughout the semester. She definitely reads everything and provides good feeback. Just make sure you have a good group for marketing project.

The class is pretty straightforward. One semester group project, 3 exams, and a final. The tests were easy if you studied for them and she always gave you a study guide in advance. I cannot complain. She also gives decent extra credit for showing up to class on random days
Videos are full of static; just read the PowerPoint and the quizzes are complex, but you can fail every one of them and still pass the class.
